item.title: Helldivers 2 Director is Letting Players Decide When They Want the Next Paid Warbond
item.description:
Highlights

  • Johan Pilestedt lets Helldivers 2 players decide when the next paid warbond will drop, acknowledging recent controversy.
  • Fans rejoice as Sony backtracks on PC account-linking decision for Helldivers 2, showing willingness to listen to player feedback.
  • Players vote overwhelmingly to release Polar Patriots Warbond on May 9, showing excitement for new content while hoping for weapon balance.

Helldivers 2 Director Johan Pilestedt wants gamers to decide when the next paid Warbond will arrive. Helldivers 2 has been the source of heated discussion in recent weeks, as it is at the center of Sony's controversial decision to have PC players link their accounts to the PlayStation Network. The wave of negative reception surrounding recent Helldivers 2 news has been a shock to many gamers because of just how popular Helldivers 2 has become in such a short time. Releasing in February 2024, Helldivers 2 is now Sony's 7th highest grossing game of all time.

Sony has since backpedaled on account-linking in Helldivers 2 after controversy from the game's fan base drew too much negative attention to make the decision worth implementing. On social media, PlayStation explained that the company is still learning what is best for their fans on PC and thanked players for their support and understanding. Consumers rejoiced over this decision, excited to have their voices heard when it comes to their favorite games.

Related
Helldivers 2 Players Petition for the Return of Fired Community Manager
Helldivers 2 players are calling for the reinstatement of a community manager who was dismissed following the PSN account-linking controversy.

Johan Pilestedt asked Helldivers 2 players when the Polar Patriots Warbond should be released and included a poll to count the results. Pilestedt explains that the team at Arrowhead does not want to release the Warbond in a tone-deaf manner following the influx of outrage from the Helldivers 2 PSN account linking controversy . Pilestedt offers two options, either releasing the Warbond on May 9, 2024, or delaying the release for some time.

Helldivers 2 Players Vote on Warbond Release Timing

In response to Pilestedt's question, many gamers have opted for the decision to release. Six hours ahead of the poll's closing, 73.9% of the 136,622 votes cast voted in favor of the May 9 release. Some fans have voiced that their request for a sooner Warbond release comes with the request to make sure the new Helldivers 2 weapon balancing is not too intense.

With the recent Helldivers 2 news causing Arrowhead Game Studios to place a stronger emphasis on player voices in their upcoming decisions, fans hope they will be heard on this matter. Many players are excited about the opportunity to spend their credits and see the new changes, but they want the fun to last. Considering the bevy of new weapons coming in the Helldivers 2 Polar Patriots Warbond , it makes sense that players want the weapons they end up enjoying the most to remain as powerful as they were when they got them. Much like the game itself, gamers do not want to pay for something that ends up changing drastically in the future.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Reveals Hela Gameplay and Abilities
item.description:
Highlights

  • Marvel Rivals trailer showcases Hela's abilities, including daggers, teleport, and area damage orb.
  • The game features classic Marvel characters like Iron Man, Scarlet Witch, and Black Panther in 6v6 matches.
  • Players can expect references to well-known Marvel locations, destructible environments, and three character classes.

Marvel Rivals has released a new trailer revealing Hela's abilities and gameplay. This year, players were surprised by the unveiling of Marvel Rivals , a shooter that pits Marvel heroes and villains against each other in 6v6 matches. Although Marvel Rivals doesn't yet have a confirmed release date, players are already looking forward to checking out the game.

Putting a Marvel spin on the team-based shooter formula, Marvel Rivals maps will reference well-known Marvel locations to players, such as Yggsgard and Tokyo 2099, along with destructible environments. The roster is made up of famous characters such as Scarlet Witch, Iron Man, Storm, Black Panther, and Namor. Players are quite curious to know anything about the looks and abilities of the Marvel Rivals characters, and NetEase recently satisfied this curiosity with a sneak peek of one of the characters that will be available in Marvel Rivals .

Related
Marvel Rivals’ Luna Snow Shouldn’t Mean a Cool X-Men Character is Off the Table
Marvel Rivals is a terrific opportunity to accentuate Luna Snow, but her abilities decrease the chances of an X-Men character making it on the roster.

Marvel Rivals has unveiled a new trailer showcasing Hela's abilities and gameplay. The Goddess of Death throws her daggers as primary fire, while alternate fire makes Hela throw a series of daggers at once, hitting enemies from a distance. Hela has a distinctive teleport, where she transforms into one of Odin's ravens and deals damage from above. Hela can cast an orb that deals area damage, and with her ultimate, the iconic Marvel villain Hela flies into the air and shoots four larger orbs at the ground, dealing significant damage to enemies.

Hela is One of the Duelist Characters Confirmed for Marvel Rivals

Like other Hela appearances over the years, including the version of Hela played by Cate Blanchett in the MCU, Marvel Rivals ' Hela wears her iconic green costume with the crown that gives her an even more intimidating presence. As in other versions, Hela appears in the Marvel Rivals trailer carrying her sword as she unleashes her attacks on her opponents. Fans previously saw another Asgard-related announcement, with Marvel Rivals confirming Loki in the shooter's playable roster.

With the release of Hela's gameplay trailer, Marvel Rivals shows that it has given the villain abilities with clever references to her powers in the Marvel comics. The trailer also shows a duelist with interesting mobility, and enough tools to harass opponents without exposing herself, with great potential to become a favorite with players. Some of the luckier ones won't have to wait long to find out what Hela will be like on the battlefield, however, as Marvel Rivals ' closed alpha will soon begin, with Hela among the available characters.

item.title: Pokemon Fan Shows Off 20 Impressive Fusion Designs
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon fusions are popular with the community, with some fans designing interesting concepts.
  • One artistic Pokemon fan has created 20 impressive fusion designs.
  • Some of the designs include fusions of Gengar and Cosmog along with Gardevoir and Celesteela.

A Pokemon fan has created a number of impressive fusion designs. Pokemon fusions have been a popular trend among fans, as molding two or more Pokemon together can create some very interesting designs. Fusions have had some sort of presence in the mainline Pokemon games since Black and White , as the Legendary Pokemon Reshiram and Zekrom have the ability to fuse with Kyurem. These are the only Pokemon able to fuse officially, however, as every other fan fusion has been non-canon.

Pokemon fusions have become especially popular with fans of the series since the release of the fan game, Infinite Fusion . Infinite Fusion takes the DNA splicer item from Black and White and uses it to its full potential. Players can take any two Pokemon from the game and combine them together to make a unique fusion of the two creatures. Fans have been collaborating with the game to insert their own interpretations of what fusions between two Pokemon would look like. Pokemon fans have made all sorts of fusion designs, from combining Bounsweet and Vikavolt, to Zubat and Onix.

Related
Pokemon Fan Designs Mega Evolution for Forretress
A talented Pokemon fan devises a new Mega Evolution for Forretress, imagining an alternative version for the Gen 2 Bug/Steel-type creature.

A user named HoundoomKaboom on Reddit uploaded 20 different fusions they designed to the site. Among them are combinations of popular Pokemon from the franchise , such as Gengar and Cosmog, Lugia and Shuckle, Lanturn and Xurkitree, Kantonian Ninetails and Alolan Marowak, and Blastoise and Aggron, just to name a few.

20 Pokemon Fusions Designed By HoundoomKaboom

  • Lugia and Shuckle
  • Magcargo and Kantonian Weezing
  • Hoopa and Gallade
  • Gardeviour and Celesteela
  • Skitty and Hoppip
  • Blastoise and Aggron
  • Lanturn and Xurkitree
  • Torterra and Duskull
  • Kantonian Ninetails and Alolan Marowak
  • Scizor and Vikavolt
  • Zoroark and Houndoom
  • Charizard and Necrozma
  • Bidoof and Necrozma
  • Drifloon and Spiritomb
  • Gengar and Cosmog
  • Kantonian Tauros and Tapu Bulu
  • Kantonian Arcanine and Dragonair
  • Kantonian Sandslash and Abomasnow
  • Hitmonchan and Cofagrigus
  • Chandelure and Conkeldurr

The Gengar and Cosmog fusion design includes a clever use of the body of Gengar. Gengar has his original shape mostly intact, but Cosmog's colors and golden parts shine through. Another fusion designed by HoundoomKaboom includes the combination of Gardeviour and Celesteela. In the design, Cressellias body makes up most of the creature, with Gardeviour's head and arms holding one of the large ligaments of Cressellia. Other Pokemon fans have made interesting fusions, which include a Mr. Mime and Gengar combination , lovingly named by the community as Mr. Gar.

The Pokemon series has barely scratched the surface of what fusions could be like in the mainline games. Some fans have suggested that fusions seem to be a logical step for Pokemon 's next generation . Sword and Shield and Black and White have already experimented with combining Legendaries together. Sword and Shield introduced Calyrex, which can be combined with either Glastrier or Spectrier to make a powerful Legendary Pokemon, sharing both creature's abilities. Black and White famously had each cover Pokemon, Zekrom and Reshiram, combine with Kyurem to create one of its forms. Perhaps the Pokemon Company will continue to explore fusions in future games.

item.title: Pokemon x Yogibo Jumbo Bean Bag Chairs Go On Sale
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon and Yogibo offer giant bean bag chairs of Gengar, Jigglypuff, and Lechonk, perfect for fans and decor enthusiasts alike.
  • Ditto and Snorlax bean bag chairs from past collabs were popular and sold out quickly, so fans should act fast.
  • These 30x30x30 inch, 12 pound bean bag chairs are limited and priced at $299.99 each, shipping in mid-October.

The Pokemon Company and Yogibo are teaming up to sell a popular trio of Pokemon, namely Gengar, Jigglypuff, and Lechonk, as giant bean bag chairs. The Pokemon recreations are functional and cuddly-looking, but could also serve as decor for fans of the series.

Pokemon and Yogibo have previously cooperated to produce bean bag chairs. Ditto and Snorlax previously got the bean bag chair treatment from Yogibo, though both have sold out since. Pokemon fans interested in buying a nice bean bag chair shouldn't wait too long, as these new bean bags may also see high demand.

Related
Pokemon Kanto Region Recreated in Terraria
One Terraria player is showing off their creative journey to replicate the Mt. Moon area from Pokemon Red and Blue in Terraria.

The Pokemon Center is now officially selling new Yogibo Pokemon bean bag chairs . Gengar, Lechonk, and Jigglypuff each received a chair that's big enough for adults to sit on. Each chair reproduces the Pokemon in charming detail, giving fans a jumbo Pokemon plush that's perfect to snuggle up with or simply sit on. Each bean bag chair features a removable cover for easy cleaning, and has an interior zipper child lock to help prevent unwanted access to the bean bag chair's filling.

These bean bag chairs are quite sizable, coming in at 30 x 30 x 30 inches each. The weight is also significant, coming in at a whopping 12 pounds. Due to its size and limited nature, the three bean bag chairs are being sold for $299.99 each. All three chairs are set to ship in mid-October, which could see Gengar arriving in time for Halloween for some fans. Unlike The Pokemon Center's Squishmallows , fans shouldn't expect these bean bag chairs to be sold anywhere else at a later date.

The Pokemon Chosen for the Yogibo Collab

Although Pikachu and starter Pokemon trios often get the most attention for collectible products, the Yogibo collection hasn't highlighted them. Of the Pokemon to see a Yogibo collab, Snorlax's sleepy nature makes it a perfect choice for a Yogibo bean bag chair, and Jigglypuff's ability to put people and Pokemon to sleep seems like a good choice, as well. Ditto's unusual design and malleable shape also make it an interesting choice. While Gengar and Lechonk don't have direct connections to rest or relaxation, Gengar has been an extremely popular Pokemon since Gen 1, and Lechonk took the internet by storm when Pokemon Scarlet and Violet first revealed its design. This popularity likely gave them an edge over other potential choices.

For fans who don't want to spend this much money, a nearly endless variety of other Pokemon decor options exist. From plushes to projectors, almost every Pokemon has been featured in some way for fans to collect, just as they do the actual creatures in-game.

item.title: Pokemon Kanto Region Recreated in Terraria
item.description:
Highlights

  • A gamer known as EaldorPrime on Reddit recreates Mt. Moon and other locations from Kanto in Terraria without mods, using creative tactics for 3D movement in 2D.
  • The detailed replica includes tunnels and a Yellow Volt Bunny, mimicking Pikachu, impressing fans with its accuracy.
  • While not the first Kanto location in a non-Pokemon game, EaldorPrime's creation shows the enduring love for Pokemon's original region.

One dedicated Terraria player has used their creative skills to transform their in-game world into a replica of Mt. Moon and its surrounding areas from the original Pokemon games. While Terraria takes place in a side-scrolling 2D landscape and Pokemon allows for 3D movement with a top-down view, this player utilized their years of experience with the game to make the transition work.

Mt. Moon is located in the Kanto region from Pokemon Red and Blue , although other Pokemon games have allowed the player to go there as well. It's found between Routes 3 and 4, and players will have to spelunk through a cave system in the mountain on their journey between Pewter City and Cerulean City.

Related
Terraria: 13 Map Seeds That Make The Game Even Harder
From the dangers of the Jungle Biome to a barren land with no ocean, these challenging map seeds might confound even Terraria veterans!

The creator of this new fan-made Mt. Moon, who goes by the Reddit handle EaldorPrime, introduced it as part six in their series of Kanto replicas made in Terraria . In order to craft the replica of Mt. Moon using Terraria 's building tools, EaldorPrime had to get creative to allow 3D movement in the 2D game. Since characters in Terraria can jump but not walk upward or downward on the screen, the player has filled the area with Echo Platforms, which can be leaped to but cannot be seen under normal circumstances. The creator says they have been playing Terraria for almost 13 years and have logged about 3,000 hours of playtime so far, and impressively, they created this world with no Terraria mods , although they did utilize "a lot for paint."

Almost An Exact Replica of Mt. Moon in Terraria

The version of Mt. Moon presented by this creator is almost an exact scale replica of the one appearing in Pokemon Red and Blue , right down to the tunnels that lead the player to other parts of the cave system. Probably the biggest difference between the remade Mt. Moon and the original is that the version in Terraria isn't filled with wild Pokemon like Zubat and Clefairy that jump out and start random battles with the player. There is a stand-in for one Pokemon, however, as the creator has opted to use a Lightning Carrot to summon a yellow Volt Bunny to follow the player character around, much like Pikachu would trail behind the main character in Pokemon Yellow . This particular attention to detail seems to have drawn the most delight out of fans who have seen the Mt. Moon build, along with the clothing choices that make the player character look like Ash Ketchum from the Pokemon anime.

While this fan's recreation of Mt. Moon is certainly impressive, it's not the first time a player has added a Kanto location to a non- Pokemon game. Earlier in 2024, another creator shared a stunning replica of the Kanto region made in Minecraft , which goes to show the appreciation players still have for Pokemon 's original region.
